member.name: EmfToWmfBitsFlags
member.summary: Specifies options for the method, which converts an Enhanced Metafile (EMF) metafile to a Windows Metafile Format (WMF) metafile.

member.name: EmfToWmfBitsFlags.EmfToWmfBitsFlagsEmbedEmf
member.summary: Specifies that the source EMF metafile is embedded as a comment in the resulting WMF metafile.

member.name: EmfToWmfBitsFlags.EmfToWmfBitsFlagsIncludePlaceable
member.summary: Specifies that the resulting WMF metafile is in the placeable metafile format; that is, it has the additional 22-byte header required by a placeable metafile.

member.name: EmfToWmfBitsFlags.EmfToWmfBitsFlagsNoXORClip
member.summary: Specifies that the clipping region is stored in the metafile in the traditional way. If you do not set this flag, the method applies an optimization that stores the clipping region as a path and simulates clipping by using the XOR operator.
